analytic.title: Syriac Proto-monasticism and Monasticism in the Light of the First Christian Community in Jerusalem (Acts of Apostels 2, 42-47 and 4, 32-35)

biblStruct.note: «To understand the Syriac proto-monasticism and the monasticism of Egyptian origin in all its phases, as purely Christian reality we must go back to the moment of supreme concentration of the action of the Holy Spirit within the millenary preparation consumed in the event-christ and effected in the pentecostal fire of the Spirit (Acts, 2,lff). Then, first of all, we must recognize the character of fulness and consequently of normativity of the first Christian community in Jerusalem (Acts 2, 42-47 and 4,32-25).» (P. 233)
